DOC.brief_summary: This study will examine the effectiveness of two types of group exercise classes on the health and functional status in inactive adults age 18-65 with neurological conditions including Multiple Sclerosis, stroke, and spinal cord injury (SCI). Participants will be randomly assigned to one of three groups; Movement to Music, Adapted Yoga, or a waitlist group who will complete a home-based exercise intervention of either Movement to Music or Adapted Yoga.
DOC.brief_title: Lakeshore Examination of Activity and Disability Exercise Response Study
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with stroke MS mild to moderate disability (Patient Determined Disease Steps Score 06) Able to use arms or arms/legs for exercise Ambulatory or use manual wheelchair Cognitive impairment (MiniMental State Exam score < 24) Recent weight change (+/ 25 pounds in 1 year) Poorly controlled blood pressure Cardiovascular disease event within the past six months Severe pulmonary disease Renal failure Current tobacco user or quit within the last six months Current use of medications for psychosis Active pressure ulcers
